I am sorry this guest was disappointed in their stay and felt that we did not deserve 4 star ranking. To suggest and question other guest experience is a subjective assessment and also to recommend different hotel chains of your liking to other guests is something that the majority of our guests do not accept. I can assure you that we take pride in our product and doing our best to go above and beyond for our guests. We also do not hesitate to honor any reasonable request by our guests to make them happy.

Summary: This was an okay hotel. I loved the air conditioning because when it was hot, it got cold real quick. The beds were comfortable. Me and my boyfriend slept good. Mcdonalds was real close, like a 2 minute walk away from the hotel. Disneyland was about 10 minutes away so i could say the location is pretty good. Bad things about this hotel.. 1, the water took forever to go down the drain in the shower, as soon as you turn on the water, it started to just fill up the tub.. 2, there was a huge nasty stain on the carpet... don't know what it was but it was gross.. 3, it smelled kinda funky at first but then got used to it.. 4, there were hardly any good channels on the tv... 5, the gardners kept us up because they were sooo loud and it was early....and 6, the "free breakfast" is coffee
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I agree with you that our hotel is centrally located to all the major attractions as well as restaurants, etc.. Lots of guests find our location very convenient and take advantage of our great deals such as ‚Äúsummer promotions". Thanks for informing us about some of the issues you had during your stay and truly sorry for any inconvenience. I have adviced my maintenance staff to look in to those issues and correct them immediately. We look forward to see you soon.

Summary: When we travel to the same destinations often, my wife & I usually try different hotels to find one that we like. Luckily on our second time out to the Knotts/Disneyland area, we found our favorite place to stay...the Good Nite Inn in Buena Park. This was our second stay here, my second review for the GNI, and it won't be our last.  The staff are all very nice & were very helpful. Faisal made my reservation. He was very pleasing and thorough. Roberto checked me in quickly (although it was at 1am when most of the guests are already checked-in) and I had a nice conversation with him during the short time it took. Faisal also was the person who checked us out.  The beds are firm, which is the exact way I like them. I always get a good night sleep here (sometimes better than at
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I am delighted to hear about your great stay with us. We are committed to our mission of making your stay a ‚Äúhome away from home" experience and I am glad my staff went above and beyond to achieve that goal. We do offer the best rates in town and I am glad that you were able to take advantage of our ongoing summer promotions. Thank you for mentioning the names of the employees who took care of you. Your kind words will motivate them further. I am excited to hear that you are planning your December vacation with us.

Summary: When I checked in, I had just come from a very long trip from Stavanger, Norway to LAX. I told Nancy G. that I had eaten breakfast the day before in Stavanger, lunch in Amsterdam, dinner in Memphis Tennessee, and that I had just eaten breakfast in Bellflower California, and that now I was very sleepy and that I was going to put the "Do not Disturb" sing out and sleep all day, because I had been traveling for longer than 24 hours. Right away, she grabbed a "Do not Disturb" sign to make sure I had one, in case there was not one in the room, and she also grabbed an extra set of towels, washcloths, and shampoo and soap for me to use the next morning before I checked out. That was very nice and appreciated. Then, when I couldn't get my "keys" which looked like credit cards, to work,
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I am delighted to hear about your great stay with us. I am glad that one of our guest service agents, Nancy, took care of you and went above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. I agree that we do have one of the beautiful pools in the area and a great way to relax at the end of the day. I thank you for being such a loyal guest and looking forward to see again.

Summary Heading: Great Place - Affordable with no complaints!
Summary: We stayed at this motel on 6/16 to 6/19 and I have to say that overall, I have no complaints! Room was clean. Towels were small and only offered a few extra per day, but it was doable. We only used our rooms to sleep, which was perfect. The mattress is very thin and hard yet we were so tired, we didn't care. I slept just fine! It took us about 10 minutes to get to Disney. Surrounding area was clean and quiet. Continental breakfast wasn't great but wasn't bad either. Don't expect a warm breakfast. The only thing they offer are muffins and donuts and they replenished at least a couple of times while we were there, b/w 7-9. If on a budget...definitely recommend!
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I am delighted to hear about your great stay with us. We are currently offering summer promotions and I am glad you were able to take advantage of these great offers. We do provide comfortable accommodation for the best price in town.  We work continually to improve our product and we are committed to our mission of making your stay a ‚Äúhome away from home".

Summary Heading: A stay that was comftorable and pleasing!
Summary: My stay here at good nite inn buena park was comffotable and pleasing.  The staff was amazing, the person who checked me in was mayra and she was very nice.  When i went to my room it was a smoking room and i requested a non smoking room, i explained this to mayra and she changed my room right away with out any issues.  There was no available rooms left but she took the time to figure out a solution.  This was very pleasing to me and i enjoyed my stay here!
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I am delighted to hear about your great stay with us. I am glad to hear that the staff went above and beyond to make your stay comfortable, specially Mayra. Your kind words will motivate them further. I look forward to see you soon.

Summary Heading: great hotel, great price, and nice staff.
Summary: Great hotel and great price , close to Knottsberry.  Front staff always willing to help and very friendly.  We always stay @ this hotel when we visit Knottsberry Farm, twice a year.  Kuddos to the staff @ Good nite Inn.  Keep up the good work.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I am delighted to hear about your great stay with us. We are committed to our mission of making your stay a ‚Äúhome away from home" experience and I am glad my staff went above and beyond to achieve that goal. I have shared your comments with my staff and your kind words will motivate them further. Thank you.

Summary: Hotel front desk personel were very friendly.  Called in to secure late arrival and had no issues.  Parking was free, a huge plus!  Check in was quick and easy, thankfully since we were traveling with 4 kids, two 9 year olds and two seven year olds.  Hotel was in a good location, convienient to both Knotts and Disney.  Never felt concerned for safety, area was quiet.  Room was clean and neat.  Basic accomadations for the price, but for a stop over on the way to Disney Hotel, it was well above expectations.  Continental breakfast was the only thing that needed work, but again for the price it was stil nice to have something in the morning.  No bed bugs, no mold, no bad area, no noise.  Easily recommend and will probably use this hotel for future stays.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Basic budget motel.  It was cheap, clean, safe but nothing more.  The nearby road was quite loud, but after having travelled a long time falling asleep was no problem.  Staff were very friendly and polite, good parking facilities.  If you have a car, the location is okay, but wouldn't attempt staying here otherwise.  The location would be good if you are wanting to visit Disneyland, but I wouldn't really want to spend too many nights here.  Can't say I "enjoyed" my stay here, but it was good value for money for a 1 night stop over before carrying on our journey.
Manager Response: I would like to thank this guest for taking the time to post their comments. I am glad that your stay was comfortable and you were able to take advantage of our great promotional rates. Our hotel is quiet compared to most other hotels in the area and the Orangethorpe Ave where we located is not the busiest compared to the Beach Blvd where majority of the other hotels are located. Most of our guests find this location much better place to relax and we have two restaurants in the same parking lot. Furthermore, if you find your room too close to the street you may request a room at the end.

Summary: Convenient to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm.  Good value.  Basic budget motel with the expected amenities.  Very friendly and helpful check-in and check-out.  Had to sign a noise policy waiver, which was comforting after a noisy night at a Motel 6.  This is on a main road, so there is street noise, but it didn't bother me.  Facilities and grounds are decent.  For the price, I was very happy with it.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I am delighted to hear about your great stay with us. Your kind words will motivate them further.

Summary: For the price, this hotel had it all. The hotel clerk Faisal at the front desk was really nice and was able to get us a room right by the pool, as we requested..even if we didnt have reservations =)  I have already reccommended this hotel to friends.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I am delighted to hear about your great stay with us. Thank you for sharing your thoughts with rest of the guests that you find us ‚Äú# 1 value in OC".  We do offer clean, comfortable rooms and friendly service all at a great price. This is why most of our guests find us as the best value in town. We are looking forward to your next stay.

Summary: I'm not picky when it comes to hotels, but I was unhappily surprised to wake up all biten, with red stains all over my body, which kept itching for 3 days!!! It's been 1,5 a week we checked out and came back to Russia, but the stains are still with me :) Very pity, 'cause the location and staff  are really nice. So, beware... Room no. 203
Manager Response: I would like to thank this guest for taking the time to post their comments and we are truly sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused during your stay. We checked the room you mentioned and did not find any signs of bugs. However, we have treated this room professionally by a pest control company to be sure. We take pride in our product and do our best to maintain it and to provide our guests with clean and comfortable rooms.  If our guests are not happy or experienced a problem we will correct the situation immediately.

Summary Heading: Spend the Extra Few Dollars to Stay Somewhere Else
Summary: When we booked the hotel (on the internet the day before we arrived) the hotel's site said that a complimentary continental breakfast was included with the room.  Traveling with young kids, we appreciated this convenience.  Upon check in, I inquired about the breakfast and was told that management had discontinued the complimentary breakfast 5 days prior.  No extra pillows were available at the front desk (told to check back in the morning!), hallways to rooms smelled strongly of garlic and bad breath, bathroom of pocket door had approximately a 2' x 2' patch of black mold on the bathroom side, the rest of the room was acceptable as a very low-budget motel.  Oh, and we had two adults and two children in our room but our bathroom only had towels for two.  Had to make another trip
Manager Response: I would like to thank this guest for taking the time to post their comments. We really do value all guest feedback as it allows us to improve our operation to better suit their needs of our guests.  Complimentary breakfast is available from 6.00 a.m. - 9.00 a.m. at the hotel lobby. Guests may request extra pillows and other amenities at the front desk. We do provide enough amenities in each guest room and guests may request more from the front desk. I suggest guests to make reservations for two bed guest rooms when they are traveling with family instead of one bed as our two bed guest rooms have more supplies( i.e. extra towels,pillows, etc) than the one bed guest rooms and suited for a family of four.

Summary: This hotel is an excellent value for your money.  You get a nice bed to sleep in, a nice hot shower, a good working air conditioning, a good working TV with HBO and a nice lobby to eat a free continental breakfast with muffins, coffee and juice.  There is always things that can go wrong on a hotel stay but with this hotel, they make sure they are fixed right away.  I needed an extra towel and pillow--boom they give it to you.  My TV wasn't working properly---boom,  Don, their repair person was there to fix it.  Check in time is at 3, but we were early, boom---Faisal the counter rep, checked if there were any rooms available and he checked us in no time.  Now that is excellent service!!!  I would stay here for sure next time I am in Orange County.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere thanks for taking time to submit the review. I am delighted to hear about your great stay with us. We are committed to our mission of making your stay a ‚Äúhome away from home" experience and I am glad my staff went above and beyond to achieve that goal. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed our amenities such as free breakfast, HBO, etc. We continue to improve our product to better serve our guests while offering the best rates in town. We look forward to see you in your next trip to Orange County.

Summary Heading: one of the good hotels i like to go to
Summary: i found this hotels on hotelguide.com and it had some good reviwes so i wanted to check it out my self....the rooms was really clean and nice and good price....next to everything and its close to knoots berry farm the staff was really friendly and my fav is maria she is really nice she really helped me out. i would really recomend this hotel to anybody and will be back again :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here from April 15-18th with my teenage daughter. We checked in after midnight and we were tired. The front desk was very friendly and got us up to our room as quick as possible. It is a simple room but very clean. We were there for a shopping weekend so we were only going to be in our rooms to sleep so this place was ideal for the price and location. We drove down to the Fashion district in downtown L.A one day and the next day, we enjoyed Buena Park shopping. There was a restaurant called the Elephant Bar which was only a couple of miles away and the food was awesome. I would stay here again if I just needed a palce to rest my head at night. I wouldnt stay here if I was going to spend lots of  time in my room. The location was great for us! The staff were awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: What a great place to stay
Summary: The price caught my attention. However, we chose this hotel after reading all the great reviews.  You don't expect to find a great place to stay for about $41.00 per night. All the positive reviews were right on the money. The rooms are clean. There's plenty of parking. The pool is nice and clean. The location is excellent, near Knotts Berry Farm and about 7 miles from Disneyland. The freeway is nearby too, but you don't hear all the noise. We got such a good night sleep. And hotel staff is excellent and professional. When we had a problem with our air conditioner, they immediately moved us to a different room. Oh yes...this hotel is next to a restaurant called Paul's Place (what can i say about Paul's Place?  Only the best restaurant in Orange County!) .  We are definitely
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Better Than Expected Great for Knotts
Summary: From when I checked in (rather late) the desk clerk was very polite and helpful. When we checked into the room did find only two towels and a wash cloth( seems standard issue)  and no shampoo. A quick vist to the desk quickly resolved the problem. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was bad if you are diabetic , (which I'm not) only OJ , coffee, and donuts.   Seems the breakfast was discontinued the next day no big loss.  We at at Pauls Resturant, across the parking lot. menu was great and inexpensive.  After we came back from Knotts, found that our DND (Do not disturb) sign was honored.  We stayed two nigts and never had an issue.    Would have been great to have a fridge and micro.   We would stay again, easy to get to Knotts and  anywhere else. Check out was
Manager Response: none

Summary: My fiance and I decided to stay in this motel for our recent trip to Anaheim based upon all of the positive feedback it had received.  It did not take long after getting to our room to discover that we were in for a bad trip.  The first thing we noticed was the smashed cockroach on the wall.  This was gross, but not yet a deal breaker.  As I walked over to sit on the side of the bed, I noticed that the bottom of the nightstand was crumbling away and falling apart.  Upon looking closer, I discovered a rather large spiderweb underneath the corner of the nightstand, not more than two feet from where we'd be sleeping.  The beds also turned out to be more solid than I generally like.  As we checked out the bathroom, we noticed a large dark stain on the wall.  Something liquid had run

Summary Heading: Great for the price and location was close to entertainment.
Summary: I think our stay was great!  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The rooms were very clean, beds were comfortable.  The stay was very quiet, it wasn't noisy from traffic or guests.  plenty of parking was available.  what I liked was if you got up late there was still hot water unlike other places I've stayed were water was gone if you were not showered by 8am.  I plan on returning again with the rest of my family next time we return to CA. for a family vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worst stay in a long time!
Summary: It seems that nothing went right on this stay. The room keys kept de-activating, leaving us locked out everytime we came to our room. We stayed for 5 nights! There were huge stains on the side of the mattress which were in open view. The plumbing is very noisy and if people check in late next to you...forget sleeping! There were 3 of us in each room and only a couple of towels. "Breakfast" was a joke...bring your own. It was very noisy with the street nearby and the other guests (which were large groups when we stayed). People sat outside their room and blocked the hallway with their legs as they drank beers. No place to throw trash larger than a paper cup. We went to the beach and our kids got dirty - there is no laundry place here. We stayed here many times before and liked
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was ok for the price.  Near enough to Disneyland.  The only problem was we had 4 people in our room and they only gave us 2 towels and 1 wash cloth.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Me, my girlfriend, and her friend visiting from Japan stayed at the Good Nite Inn over the weekend.  We checked in after a long day at Disneyland and were happy to find a nice clean room with comfortable beds. We needed one more set of towels, but the issue was resolved quickly and easily. The staff was very friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. I am still amazed at the price - we have spent more than double per night at other hotels for similar quality to this place! The next time we visit the Anaheim and Buena Park area, we will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Spend the extra money and stay some where nicer...
Summary: We booked two rooms for a great price and figured we wouldn't be in the rooms most of the time, this is the only reason we didn't check into another hotel.  There was a HUGE stain in the carpet who knows what it was..gross!..And then the shower had baby spiders roaming around in it, then there was MOLD above the shower, and the door to the bathroom was horrible...it had what looked like mold, but not sure what it was, I took pictures of everything...and decided I would post them with this review so that the ratings on this hotel would come down some, because I don't know where all the good reviews came from, maybe we were on a different planet...then we asked for a roll away bed when we made the reservation and were told that it would be in the room waiting for us...NOPE...never

Summary: I really don't understand the positive reviews about this hotel. We booked here because of being #1 one Tripadvisor, and were horribly disappointed. The front desk staff is friendly, but not overly friendly. Just average. We got up to our room, and there were 2 men in our room that greeted us and apologized because that particular room was currently under investigation, so they would call down and get us a new room assigned immediately. Which they did. So we got to our new room, and the second we opened the door, it reeked of Ben Gay. The wallpaper was peeling at almost every seem, and it looked like someone had taken fruit punch and splattered it all over the walls. The furniture was from the 70's, the beds were poorly made with VERY OLD linens. The carpet was extremely stained

Summary Heading: This hotel had the best service at such a great price!
Summary: Since I'm on a budget, I was trying to find a decent hotel at a low price.  This was a last minute reservation so I was unsure of what i would find.  I was very fortunate when I booked my reservation at the Good Nite Inn in Buena Park, CA.  Not only was it a convenient location, but you couldn't beat the low price.  I can't believe how much money i wasted at other hotels.  I pay almost twice the price at other hotels.  The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and I didn't break my bank for the room.  What more could you ask for...Plus, there was a McDonalds a few steps away which made it really convenient when you needed a bite to eat without spending any more in gas.  Overall, two thumbs up!

Summary Heading: It was pleasure to stay here.
Summary: I found this hotel online on Hotels.com and was drawn to it because of the location and the price.  I was greeted by a very friendly staff.  The room was perfect.  My friend smokes so we got a smoking room (rare to find these days) and was pleased that it didnt smell like an old ashtray.  It was a perfect room, just what I needed to relax and get away.  We went to Knotts and found it an easy drive and nice to come back to the room and relax. Upon check out Faisal was very friendly.  I found everything about my visit to be perfect.

Summary: I travel constantly between California and Nevada and live out of a suitcase.This is due to the demands in running a small business in a tough economy. The front desk staff of Samantha, Maria and Mayra (different shifts) have done everything possible to accommodate my schedule changes and provide me with a clean, quiet room at a great price. I know the area very well and this the best value in Buena Park, California! This is not a Four Star Resort  or an extended stay hotel with in-room cooking equipment but at the under $50/ night price point it cannot be beat! The beds are comfortable with thick mattresses  which is a major complaint I have with their competition. I have already booked return visits at this hotel.

Summary: The price was really a nice surprise when I went to book at hotel near Knotts Berry Farm. Didnt know what to expect for the great rate....you get what you pay for they say. The room large, clean, smelled good and the bed was a KING and comfortable. Was really surprised for the price. I will definately stay there again! I highly recommend it. It did take about 25 minutes to walk to Knotts Berry Farm....but I needed the walk to burn off the cotton candy, hamburgers and ice cream. The hotel was great. Only thing...wished the breahfast shut down at 10am instead of 9am.

It is not a luxury hotel, but for $32 a night (after taxes) I wasn't about to complain!! Be prepared there is soap and one small bottle of shampoo for amenities. Also, there was only one hand towel, one washcloth and two smaller towels. One stop at the front desk remedied that problem, and we were set for the rest of our stay. The breakfast was nothing fancy, but I was please to see that they had fresh muffins as well as the pastries and juice. It worked for a small meal, and hey it was free!! For

Summary: The primary appeal of Good Nite is value.  I stayed for $36 a night before tax.  I don't think you can do better for that in the area.  As for the property:  Very much like a Motel 6.  Nothing fancy, but clean and the neighborhood is safe.  The breakfast is what you'd find at a Motel 6 - pastries, juice, and coffee.  But, there are restaurants (incluing McDonalds) that are walking distance if you want something more substantial.  The front office staff was fine.  For my purposes, it was a convenient location.  I stayed mid-week and the hotel didn't have many guests so it was pretty quiet.  Over weekends and during summer, it is probably a different story.  Contrary to some of the other reviewers' experience, I didn't see any roaches.

Summary: We chose this hotel  for a one night stay after a day in Disneyland.  It is very close to the park  and that's the only thing we enjoyed.  When we checked in at 9:30, we got a room downstairs that smelled like dirty feet.  We didn't want to even sit on the beds, the carpets were yucky, matresses were thin, pillows flat.  We complained and were pleased to be given another room right away, this one on the second floor. This room didn't have the disgusting smell,  but it could use a make over. The continental breakfast was only muffins and danishes.

If that wasn't bad enough,  the bathroom floor had not been cleaned.   Someone missed the toilet while taking a crap and it was smeared on the floor.   The next day,  I complained about the room.  They let me change rooms but when I returned at the end of the day,  I was locked out of the room.   I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Summary: Very good value for the price.  Ideal for family traveling on a budget (aren't we all).  Well situated if you want to visit both Knott's & Disneyland. Summary Heading: What a great stay for the great price!
Summary: I booked this hotel at $36/night, and me and my fiance were somewhat worried as to how the condition would be for the price. After looking at the pictures online and reading others reviews, we decided to give it a shot, and I am glad we did! Although it would be somewhat of a walk to Knott's (we ended up driving), you can't beat the price. It was close to the freeway, close to The Pirate's Dinner Adventure and Knott's, which we attended all. The breakfast is not much, except muffins, coffee and juice, and they don't seem to restock for the whole amount of time, but I really didn't expect much from the price. All in all, it was a comfortable, descent stay, and if I wanted to stay in Buena Park again, I'm sure I'd take a look at booking this one again!

No refridgerator or coffeemaker in our room, although I read in reviews there would be. Location is OK.

Needless to say, we could not stay there.   Since Good Nite Inn was directly across the street-we went there and Nancy at the Front desk was very courteous and helpful.  She let us see two rooms (one with a fridge and totally free of bugs, thank God.    The room was spacious and a good deal for the money so we could visit Knotts nearby. Summary: Overall we had a very pleasant stay at the Good Nite. We were reluctant to book it at first, because of the horrible reviews that we had read about this place. If you are expecting the Taj Mahal then you need to pay for it at a 5 star hotel and shut up. We did not stay in our room hardly the whole time anyway, and we never did eat the danishes or the coffee for breakfast. It is impossible for us to be up and out of the room by 9:00 am anyway. What we did do was go to Paul's Place one or two times a day. It is a really cute diner with pretty cheap prices a short walk across the parking lot. The menu selection was awesome. Manager Response: Thank you for the great comment and kind words. We do our best to go above and beyond to serve our guest. Summary: ABSOLUTE NIGHTMARE.  Filthy, smelly and extremely rude people. When we arrived, there was blood on my sheets. Manager Response: I want to thank the guest for her feedback. I am extremely sorry to hear that she did not have a comfortable stay at our hotel. We always go the extra mile for our guest and do our best to make them happy. However, we understand that on rare occasions we find some guests are not happy with our service. In such occurrences we do investigate where we went wrong. We appreciate negative comments as we could improve ourselves further.   Upon investigating the guest complaint we found out that most of the comments made by the guest are not legitimate. Our intention is not to post a negative comment to the guest, but to provide truthful information to our loyal guest on what occurred and stick to the facts.   When the guest checked out we found out that there were 6 people in the room. During the guest stay, she refused housekeeping service everyday. We now understand this is to avoid us from finding out extra guest in the room. If the stay was bad as guest depicts any reasonable person would check out immediately. However, guest informed me all the issues she was having on the day that she was checking out. We also find it extremely hard to believe that one of our staff members requested a slice of pizza. Pizza companies directly deliver orders to the room. There is no reason for Pizza delivery person to stop by the front desk. A Hotel in our caliber does not have $ 20 rooms. One could check on-line or call us to find out our rates.   Even though the complaint was found to be baseless we don‚Äôt want to loose any guests and we still want her to return back to us. We offered her 50% off on one night stay which we find reasonable given the facts. Discount was offered on good guest relation basis not as admission of fault.

Summary: We based our booking from trip advisor tips. The room was very cheap compared to other places closer to Disney etc. We just caught public transport to Disney etc. and it was fine. Also caught the bus to Longbeach and Huntington beach. It all leaves from just outside the parking lot on the main rd. (Getting a bus timetable a figuring it all out was the main hurdle). Fast food places are also steps away from the premises. We also walked down to Target etc. along the main road.  Room had no smell, bathroom and sheets were clean, no problems with the staff. There was also an ice machine we used to fill up our ice bucket to keep our drinks cool. Air-con worked fine. Would recommend staying here as a cheap base for activities out in LA.

Summary Heading: Great location at a great price!
Summary: I was very happy with my stay at the Good Nite Inn Buena Park. It was clean, had the best price of anyplace I checked in the area, and the location is absolutely perfect if you plan on seeing the sites around L.A. If you're not familiar with L.A, you will find out very quickly that everything is spread out. The best thing to do is base yourself in the middle of it all, and this hotel is definitely that. It is right by the 91 which runs east and west, and the 5 which runs north and south. The beach (Huntington) is 20 mins from the hotel. Knotts Berry is 2 minutes away, and Disney is about 15 mins. Summary: It was a great stay at Good Nite close to Golf club. They had good rates and decided to give it a try. Basic ameneties and clean room. This is a great budget hotel to save money. Continental breakfast was available, but I had a full breakfast at golf club. I will return.

And there was also some mechanical noise coming from the wall.  Complimentary continental breakfast was not a lot and they didn't refill so if you're planning to have it, will need to go early before it runs out.  But there is a McDonald right next door.  Overall it's a very good budget hotel.  It's about 20 mins away from Disney, 1 hour away from Universal Studios and more than 1 hour away from Magic mountain.

I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a simple decent low priced room in this area. Summary: We read the reviews and decided on this motel for our stay while going to Disneyland. All we cared about was a clean room and relative quiet. We reserved and pre-paid for a non-smoking room with two beds for three nights. We even called for late arrival, knowing it may be close to midnight before we checked in, having spent the day at Disneyland. We arrived at the motel tired and ready for sleep, walked into the room and were assaulted by heavy cigarette smoke. It permeated the room. Our eyes and throats burned, we tried to air out the room quickly to no avail. Between the two beds alone, I picked up four pieces of trash, a cigarette lighter, a burned match and a beer bottle cap. Assuming the rest of the room wasn't cleaned either, we stripped the beds and chose to sleep in our
Manager Response: My apologies to you for the experience during your stay with us.  I have currently taken over this property and you will be glad to know that we have currently gone through many changes including our rooms.  Just to inform you that when booking on the internet a non smoking is a request and is not guaranteed.  I was glad to hear that we were able to get you into to a room that was satisfying to you and you family.  My apologies for the painters awakening you, they should not have started so early.  If you are ever in the area again please give us another chance to show you the changes that have been made.  Sincerely,  Garrett Bender General Manager

Summary: Excellant location just off the freeway. Hotel grounds were nice with palm trees and lovely pool although it was too cold to go in during February. Free breakfast of toast, english muffins, danishes satisfied morning hunger. Had reserved a non-smoking room but informed all left was a a smoking one. Room was a bit musty first night but didn't bother us rest of the stay. Staff was helpful. Knott's Berry Farm is about 5 minutes away so great spot to stay at. While 30 minutes from LAX (l.a. airport) quiet, safe neighborhood is well worth the distance. Great mexican restuarants within minutes as well. Recommended place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this property when it was a Fairfield Inn many times.  It was always a pleasure to stay here.  The staff was very helpful and pleasant.  The rooms were a little older looking but for the money this place is a bargain!

Summary: I was very pleased with our stay at this motel. we stayed there for 2 nights as we went to knotts. the rooms were very clean as was the pool also. I was most impressed by the front desk staff. they went out of there way to be of any help they could to us, giving driving directions and anything else we needed. they were always pleasant and seemed to care that we enjoyed our stay. I would definitely stay there again. it was a great motel and was very affordable.

Summary: My husband and I had a great stay at the Fairfield Inn-Buena Park. If you are traveling on a budget, this is a great place to stay. If you do not want to be in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the Disneyland resort this is the place. The freeway is one block away and it can get you the disneyland in 10 minutes. The rooms are clean and the enviroment is very safe. There is a security guard patroling the grounds at all times. The staff was very helpful and our room was always clean and made up when returned from our day out. Teh complementry continental breakfast was coffee, juice, bagels, pastries, and cereal. Overall we would stay here again. It was very comfortable.
